AltBase.Description: This function sets all values of quantity with respect to the base values.
AltBase.Name: AltBase

AsInQty.Description: This function treats the quantity received as Inward Quantity.
AsInQty.Name: AsInQty

AsOutQty.Description: This function defines the quantity sent as Outward Quantity.
AsOutQty.Name: AsOutQty

AsQty.Description: This function converts the numeric expression to quantity.  It compares a quantity with non quantity numeric expression.
AsQty.Name: AsQty

AsSignedQty.Description: This function is used to change the sign of the supplied value.
AsSignedQty.Name: AsSignedQty

IfCr.Description: This function verifies if the value is a Credit value and returns True.
IfCr.Name: IfCr

IfDr.Description: This function verifies if the value is a Debit value and returns True.
IfDr.Name: IfDr

IfForexCr.Description: This function verifies if the Forex value is a Credit value and returns True.
IfForexCr.Name: IfForexCr

IfForexDr.Description: This function verifies if the Forex value is a Debit value and returns True.
IfForexDr.Name: IfForexDr

IfInwards.Description: This function returns True if the quantity is an Inward quantity and returns True.
IfInwards.Name: IfInwards

IfOutwards.Description: This function verifies and returns True if the quantity is an Outward quantity.
IfOutwards.Name: IfOutwards

IsInwards.Description: This function returns True if the quantity is an Inward quantity.
IsInwards.Name: IsInwards

NettQty.Description: This function gives the Nett Quantity of the parameters passed.
NettQty.Name: NettQty

QtySubtract.Description: This function is used to subtract two quantity values which are passed as a parameter. It accepts two parameters of type Quantity and returns a quantity value along with units.
QtySubtract.Name: QtySubtract

UnitSymbol.Description: This function gives the unit in which quantities are measured. When the above function is applied for quantities the unit in which the quantities are measured will be returned.
UnitSymbol.Name: UnitSymbol
